Wow!Design and Case:Nikon made it look like a DSLR, as many cameras in this class do to be able to have a large zoom and bigger, well, everything including the screen, flash, microphones, and even four batteries in the hand-hold. The blue glossy plastic looks great and can hold up to scratches relatively well. Buttons are well placed, although there is one to let the flash up, meaning you better remember to release it on a dark shot, because it doesn't automatically. Lens cap is basic, you might have to finagle to get it on. The hand hold is rubberish, very nice to your hand and your shot.Tech:You can choose the type of batteries you put in in setting for better efficiency. Zoom in two places is a little overkill for me, but some may like it. Stereo mikes really don't make to much of a difference considering they are an inch from each other. Buttons are basic, you will recognize the symbols from your first digital camera. Screen is great quality with what looks like a high ppi, size is just right.Shooting:Simple as ever if you want to take a picture, no settings, no filters, auto everything. It's called auto mode, and it's for the people who just don't care and want a good quality pic. But oh you can do so much more! Straight up modes also include portrait (recognizing faces), scene (I'll get into that later), and easy auto, where it picks a scene for you.Scenes:Very good ones to pick from, most have special things about them such as; in sports mode, it takes three, food mode you change the tint. Panorama assist is dreary along with it's brother, 3D. On both, when you take a picture, it shows the out line of the edge of it that you have to line up with your surrounds, which isn't as easy as it sounds.UI and Settings:Hit that little menu button and it will take you to different settings depending on the mode you were in. Some are obvious, white balance, megapixel count, ISO, filters, and how many shots to take on a click. But that's just the shooting menu. When you cruise onto movie menu from the side, again, even easier than shooting. Go to set up and you open a big can of worms. Anything you possible want to change about the camera is found on three pages of options. Those intimidated by technology are warned to leave them be. Those who like cameras, dive on in. I recommend going over every setting and figuring out what it does, so in the future you know. Things like Eye-Fi upload, vibration reduction, and motion detection are wonderful.Overall the UI is straightforward as long as you know what it all means, as navigation is easy.Recommend for anybody

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Leahpeah
Reviews.Content: This item takes a while to focus and some of the pics look outstanding on the LCD screen but once printed are blurry and fuzzy. Not as nice as I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Shots!
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The shots look professional and its hard to take a bad shot. Just read the instructions that come with it before hand and you are good to go!

Reviews.Title: Rating of Nikon
Reviews.Author: Teresa A. Larson
Reviews.Content: The zoom does not move as smoothly as my last Nikon. It takes it awhile to get to the place I would like to have it, then I have missed the image.

Reviews.Title: Does not have a charger - only rechargeable batteries
Reviews.Author: Camera user
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is fine - good pictures, easy to use, etc.  However, the fact that it is battery operated and you need to buy a whole separate battery charger, instead of just having a wall charger, is really annoying. I would not purchase this again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: Difficult instructions
Reviews.Author: Lightkeeper "Lightkeeper"
Reviews.Content: Instruction booklet that came with the camera was hard-to-understand - even the built-in menu is difficult.  I wish now I had gone with a Cannon.  I do say though that this Nikon makes great pictures once you know how.

Reviews.Title: loves nice things
Reviews.Author: C. Nevers
Reviews.Content: I purchase a Nikon, Coolpix L810 in November of 2012; takes great pictures, but the lens will not come out of the camera.  Went to my granddaughters 5th birthday party and each time I took the lens cap off and turned the camera on- I got a message - take lens cap off.  I reviewed the book - could not find any helpful hints or tips. Got online to find help and the only thing I could find was that I need to send the camera in for repair.  The camera is only 6 months old has been used very gently.  I have babied this camera and I am very disappointed.  The camera was not cheap.  Help has been very difficult to obtain - or non existent - therefore I would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Ramona Puget
Reviews.Content: Pictures are not focused right and the quality is very poor.  Bought it for our organization to take pictures at our events and its not up to par for what we need.  The camera is difficult to figure out and my staff does not like it.

Reviews.Title: close-up not good
Reviews.Author: Lei Pan "nicemike99"
Reviews.Content: this camera is good to shoot far. but 1,2 inches close-up is extremely unclear because the auto focus is stupidly made. they should learn from smart phone's camera

Reviews.Title: Poor product and customer service
Reviews.Author: NCScott
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 6 months ago( not on Amazon) and it was a very nice camera for the price.  However, 5 months into using the camera it will not turn on!  I contacted support and they first suggested to change the battery setting to "correct" battery type on the menu options. After responding and explaining to them that the camera does not turn on, they gave me a web link.  This link was to schedule a warrantee repair.  After following the instructions, to my shock, I have to pay for the shipping to repair the camera!  When I asked if they had a RMA # for returning the product I was directed to the web page again.Although the camera worked ok initially and took good pictures, I would not recommend this product to anyone.  Both the product and service are horrible!

Reviews.Title: Best camera you're going to get in this price range
Reviews.Author: Temo
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera for the money if you take a lot of stills. If you take a lot of actions shots, like kids in sports, etc.....don't get it. It's focus time and shutter speed are just too slow for action. Some of the other reviews saying all the pictures turned out blurry make me suspect they did not download the CD that came with it titled "Reference Manual". If you read through it, and practice for a few days adjusting ISO and white balance, you'll get fantastic photos. The physical paper manual in the box is really just a quick overview, and doesn't provide much help, but the downloadable manual really does. This is indeed a point & shoot camera, but a little fancier, so you will have to spend some time with it. Don't order this and expect to pull it out of the box and go on a trip the next day with it. You'll be disappointed. I've had it a few days now, and I still have lots more to learn. It is very comfortable to hold, great grip, and great screen on the back. I'll post an update after I've used it a bit, too.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift.
Reviews.Author: D.Kelly
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for christmas on a special black friday deal. It's a great camera but not as good as I expected it to be. Most moving shots come out blurry and if I don't use the flash (even in well lighted areas) it comes out fuzzy and blurry. I have got a few really good shots on it with a crisp capture. Not as high quality as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: unimpressed.
Reviews.Author: Kara O
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera.  I was so excited to find this camera, a Nikon no less, and eagerly anticipated it's arrival.  When it arrived, I devoured the owner's manual, and set it up.  First negative, it feels cheap.  Lightweight plastic, with an especially flimsy battery case.  Taking pictures, I noticed that it is slow to respond, slow to focus, and the images are not as clean and crisp as expected.  Got that feeling immediately that I had made a bad purchase and sent it back.  Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Not good if the subject is moving...at all!
Reviews.Author: angela
Reviews.Content: I love the pictures this camera takes if no one is moving AT ALL.  If your subject is in motion...no good.  I've taken lots and lots of blurry pictures; these include pictures of people just breathing.  I've read the instructions (which were very vague) and still had no luck.  There's even a sports mode (must be for chess!); every picture of my son playing basketball was blurry.  I've tried with and without the flash.  Not happy!!

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed
Reviews.Author: Andrea Ficocello
Reviews.Content: Easy is easy to use, however, I have used many different settings and don't feel the camera's zoom takes clear pictures.  I also found evening/indoor pictures can become blurry unless you hold VERY still or utilize a tripod or stationary surface for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Lydia Marks
Reviews.Content: Really impressed! I wanted a good quality camera. I am not a professional photographer but looking to take some great photos and start learning! Love it! Read some reviews and bought a couple of recommended add ons like the rechargeable energizer batteries and it makes it even better! Great

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Beth M Anderosn
Reviews.Content: This was my first Nikon and it was good, but not up to what I wanted. I had been told by people that it could get good sports shots but it did not get it like I had hoped. This is now my back up camera when I don't need to use a larger one

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy to use camera that is simple to use and has wonderful features. Love this camera whether it is used for close ups or action pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera good pics good all around It is a NIKON The best camera I have ever had ...

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Self22
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an upgrade after have a cheap $150 dollar camera for years. Now living in a foreign country with much to see and photograph. I however am not a camera wiz, so I needed something that was fairly simple to use. This camera seems to do the trick. It is very simple to use but still takes lovely photos. The only thing I do not like is the battery situation. I prefer battery packs that you can recharge. I guess I could always buy rechargeable batteries. Still I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: With reservation
Reviews.Author: Ron Miller
Reviews.Content: The main problem is slow or inaccurate focusing. So, practice the partial press until focussing is complete before following thru to take the pict.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera !!!
Reviews.Author: James Hoppe
Reviews.Content: This is the last camera I will ever need to purchase. Camera does it all !!!  Small, light weight,fits perfect in my hand, easy controls that a second grader can figure out. Perfect !!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and Quality
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Velez Fajardo
Reviews.Content: The camera is stunning, the photos are very good and excellent quality, I am very satisfied with the product I will continue buying this brand.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: Recently ordered another camera which did everything that I needed and quite a lot more.  The problem is that I don't need everything it offered.  This camera is easy to set up and very easy to use.  Would recommend it for anyone who wants sharp professional photos.

Reviews.Title: coolpix 810 nikkon digital camera
Reviews.Author: dawn rinehart
Reviews.Content: nice camera, good pictures, you have to read the book to run it-if you don't use it often enough to memorize it, though. good zoom, i need to be able to get pictures out in the middle of the rodeo arena, i need to get quick shots, and closeups of the grandprincess, so i'm ready.

Reviews.Title: Great for Sports Events or Vacations
Reviews.Author: Karl H. Kudlich
Reviews.Content: The 26x Optical Magnification brings sports events in close.  Great for scenic pictures and then switch to action pictures orother type of movement.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Marler0518
Reviews.Content: It is the nicest camera I have ever owned. I feel like a professional photographer!!! The only glitch is that you have to push a button for the flash to work, and sometimes the pictures don't turn out. But all you have to do is change your angle, and you can get a magnificent shot. Wouldn't recommend for beginning photographer. But perhaps not for a professional photographer either. It is a very nice camera, that I would recommend for intermediate photographers. :D

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: KAREN K BAACK WELDING
Reviews.Content: This Nikon is great. It take such great pictures and is easy to use.  I really love it and the color is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Cindy O
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of its nearly 5-star rating; however, I should have heeded the warnings from those who did not rate it well. It wasn't until I was having issues that I found my complaints to be quite similar as those who also disliked this camera. First off, the quality of the indoor shots and outdoor night shots are surprisingly poor for a Nikon. The pictures were dark or very sensitive to your movement. The shutter speed is much slower than we expected in spite of our changing settings around and with the flash on, it seems like we were smiling ridiculously at this camera for an eternity before it snaps the shot. We had so many blinking people in our pics it was almost comical had it not been so frustrating. The "anti-red eye" feature that blinks that orangey light before snapping the shot seems to be slow working and flashes FOREVER like a warning beacon throwing everyone off because it actually makes you feel nervous! So we were lucky if no one blinked; I guess the goal there is that there are no red eyes because everyone in the pictures will have their eyes closed! Plus, what adds insult to injury, is the camera will snap the shot, then freeze the image with the clever little question, "Did someone blink?" to mock you over and over while forcing you to take the darn shot again. I have three children 10 years old and younger, I can assure Nikon that while this feature no doubt raises the level of technical intelligence of this camera over others, retakes of any sort do not bode well with the younger set, so we have a great number of would-be great pics had two of the three kids not blinked but refused to take it over. Sigh. Outside during the day, the pictures were nice and the camera responded well to the different scene adjustments; however, like the indoors, it is sensitive to your movement. If you move even slightly while shooting, the image blurs and like the indoors, it takes so long just to take a picture in the first place... We adjusted settings and "scenes" as suggested which helped somewhat, but it is still slow, and for action shots - forget it. By the time the camera snaps the photo, the subject in speedy action will have already gone thru customs and hopped a plane toChina. No joke. We took the camera sledding, and I attempted numerous times to get my kids coming downhill. I must have taken 50 pictures of an empty hill before I finally had to do an intervention with myself to just stop the insanity. We gave this Nikon every benefit of the doubt as we endured a Christmas snow trip, a Winter School Pageant, and Christmas Day together. Sadly, I have learned that I am, indeed, not smarter than this contraption from you-know-where, in spite of my reading the user guide cover to cover and having my sister who IS a professional photographer play around with it for me and show me a few tips. To no avail: even she said for the money, we could have bought something much more user-friendly with higher quality pics, so back in the box it went and we are thankful Amazon has such a great return policy. I am hoping to start feeling smarter again very soon when my Canon arrives. :0)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: George Havel
Reviews.Content: This is my review for the Nikon Coolpix L810 (red). I have been wanting a full sized DSLR for some time now, But my wife decided to get this one for me for Christmas. This camera is just a larger version of my current point and shoot version. Don't get me wrong, this is a very good camera. If you are looking to upgrade and do not want the larger full size DSLR then this is and awesome choice. With the 16.1 MP and 26x zoom you can't go wrong. Oh yeah, and the second zoom toggle on the lens is a wonderful addition! I put the camera on a sandbag and zoomed in to take a pic of the moon... zoomed in all the way and the moon was so large it was outside of the viewing area. Now that was cool. And the photo was very clear too.I have found one issue since I have been using it; the timer is set at 10 seconds and you have to keep turning it on if you want to take multiple pics in a row. Meaning, turn on timer...snap pic...turn on timer...snap pic. I would have also liked to see a 2 second timer choice. Maybe we could get a software update for this, Nikon?All in all though, I like the Coolpix L810. It may grow on me a bit more the more often I use it. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: monica
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: Buena compra, llego en perfectas condiciones excelente producto, sumamente recomendado y el envio impecable.Muy conforme, ahora a disfrutarlo con estas fiestas .

Reviews.Title: Adoro esta camara
Reviews.Author: Jose Valdez E. "JJ Valdez E."
Reviews.Content: Todo el mundo cuando ve mis fotos dice que son fotos profesionales.  Buena calidad en la imagen, grava videos en 720p y con un sonido estero pues tiene dos micrófonos.Excelente producto.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda Cochran
Reviews.Content: I love my new Coolpix camera....it is pretty, lightweight, nice size....and most importantly takes great photos!!!  I'm still learning all the settings, but am having a blast!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera with great photo quality
Reviews.Author: EG
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost two months and have had the chance to take photos under different conditions.Even without the flash, the camera takes clear and relatively bright pictures indoors though the colors tend to be more towards the yellow part of the spectrum (this may be caused by the incandescent lighting rather than the fault of the camera).  Turning on the flash will make the pictures appear more to a white tinge.There are two automatic modes: auto mode and easy auto mode.  I'm not sure why people would need two.  There are settings for all sorts of different conditions like landscape (with panorama stitching mode), portrait, close-up, snow, fireworks, museum, etc.  I haven't tried all of them yet but judging from the quality of the pictures I've seen, I expect them to be outstanding too.The camera takes high quality 720p movies.  The only problem that I've found is that the file size becomes very large.  During playback, the sound and video become out of sync after several minutes.  Again, I think this is a problem with the QuickTime movie format rather than the camera.  I wish it had a feature to save movies in MPEG-3 or -4 formats.One of the things that has amazed me is that how long the battery life is for the camera.  It takes four AAs but lasts more than my earlier digital camera.  In my older camera, I would need to replace the two AA batteries after taking 50 pictures.  I've taken more than 100 with the new camera so far and the power level is still above 75%.Another nice feature is that the camera will show a warning message if you attempt to turn it on with the lens cap still in place.

Reviews.Title: Great camera alternative to DSLR
Reviews.Author: WDG
Reviews.Content: I  was wanting to upgrade my camera from my puny point and shoots that were overpriced and not that good. We didn't have the budget for a DSLR and didn't want to keep in the rut of the puny P&S;'s. This is a great option! The zoom and clarity is great. It's easy to operate and takes great pictures. I am very pleased with this camera and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: OMG
Reviews.Author: Esther
Reviews.Content: we love it!!! was better than what we expected cant stop using it love all the features and the color

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Eric Piggford
Reviews.Content: I got this for a christmas present for my GF who is starting out with a intrest in takiing pictures. Nice clean camera that takes clear nice pictures and is a step up from the cheaper ones out there. Stepping stone to a more involved camera that Im sure is comming soon. Great camera for the money

Reviews.Title: Slow autofocus
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Parker "Fat Charlie"
Reviews.Content: The autofocus on this camera is very slow. It was VERY hard to get any pictures of our pet dogs in focus because they constantly move, and the camera keeps trying to refocus. You can do it by aiming your camera at a stationary object and depressing the shutter button half way and HOLD it there. This sets the focus and exposure and holds it as long as you hold the shutter button. Then while holding the button half way, pan the camera over to the picture you want to take, and depress the button the rest of the way. Of curse you need to select a stable object with similar lighting and distance for this to work.I think the problem is worse when zooming in tight with the telephoto. Camera shake and subject movement is more pronounced affecting the autofocus software. I had better luck with an older Fuji 12 megapixel point and shoot with my dogs:(The color and skin tones come out well UNLESS you use the flash as supplemental light. Now you've got a white balance problem because the color temperature of the flash and the room light will be different. This will be a problem with any camera shooting jpeg; you can fix it with post processing if your camera shoots raw mode. This camera seems to have more difficulty when the room is well lit and you add the flash as fill in.The camera is easy to use, and the zoom works very well. Typical snapshots of people and scenery turn out well.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: Nice, simple, easy-to-use camera.  It doesn't give you the freedom to do interesting shots like with a DSLR, but it takes quality pictures, comparable to a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Hard to focus
Reviews.Author: David Geller
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to get focused pictures. I tried multiple settings (Auto and manual) and eventually gave up and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera but confusing features
Reviews.Author: Way Too
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my wife to replace her old Cannon.  Over all I give it high marks for picture quality, really great 26 power zoom feature, and relatively simple controls.  The one problem I have had with this camera is the flash.  When you open the flash (it pops up) you have to set it using the flash icon on the menu wheel each time or it will not operate.  Other than that we really like it.  One other nice feature is the fact that it uses AA alkaline or rechargeable batteries which are ubiquitous so you don't need any special chargers or adapters. I added a  16GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card and it will take about 7500 HD photos or more than an hours worth of HD video.So while I do recommend this camera I do wish there was an auto setting for the flash so that you don't have to set it each time you want to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: Easy camera for daily usage
Reviews.Author: S!D
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the picture quality and easy handling. Pre-set modes are great feature. Battery needed to be rechargeable as the camera this huge and loaded consumes a lot of battery.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: leona
Reviews.Content: i buy this camera for a friend that is going to start in communications, so i thougth is a good one to a start... is realy nice one, the only thing is that u have to buy rechhargabke batterys and an extra memory....

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Mathews
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix L810 is a pretty solid camera all around.  I have to warn you though if you are hoping for a small compact this is not for you, but if you get a  small compact you wont have the zoom, in most cases.  The Coolpix L810 has great zoom and good resolution, but obviously that is just a stat thrown out by makers, the limiting factor in image quality is the sensor. I'll start off with throwing out a few cons.as with most cameras at that price range, it struggles with higher ISO -- so low light photographyIt has a decent flash attachment so my previous con is not quite as large.It is a little slower than some cameras, but so are most of the "crossovers". It takes about 2.3 seconds for it to be ready to take photos so it is a little slower.  Again, this is also common among crossover cameras.One thing i'd like to point out is something not often taken into account.  It uses 4AA batteries instead of a rechargeable battery pack, which can be both good and bad.  AA weigh more than the battery packs causing the camera to weigh more, and AA tend not to last quite as long, but then AA are ten times more easy to come by. All those things are me just being completely nit-picky.  You can't expect a budget, semi-compact, camera the rival photo quality of say, a DSLR. That said, it has great zoom as well as being quite capable at macro photography. All around it is a solid camera for a wide range of implementations, and all for only 250 dollars presently on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: mssk
Reviews.Content: I love the Coolpix L810 camera. The large 3 inch viewing screen makes it easy to take great shots of my two dogs. The zoom is really good at the dog park to catch all the action.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Desmarais
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera even if you don't take many pics. I really like the video, as well as the still photos. I especially like the option to take pics with or without flash.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: AAM
Reviews.Content: excellent great camera very good price value. is compact and has good performance high quality photos widely recommend ito

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: davkaren
Reviews.Content: This canera for the price is wonderful. The picture quality is so clear & bright , you can't tell if it was done professionally or not. There are so many setting that change the pic up. Amazing for the price!  I got 1 for my oldest daughter for her b/day then turned around 2 months later & bought my other daughter the same camera in another color.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jacob robin
Reviews.Content: Pictures are awesome, always crystal clear but the shutter is really slow. If you are planning on taking back to back pictures this camera is not for you

Reviews.Title: It's a great camera but i was expecting for something better
Reviews.Author: Fabiana Ramos
Reviews.Content: it has an amazing zoom and a great resolution,  it's hard to get a great picture during movement. With a little of practice you can achieve a good picture but it's not easy. For the price, you get an excellent product. If i could turn back in time, i would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Review of camera
Reviews.Author: David W. Brown
Reviews.Content: The on-line reviews were correct about the auto-focus on full zoom, but it still meets my needs very well. Nice camera.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Basil
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera.  It has only one problem which I do not like.  It takes a lot of time to focus on a subject.  By the time it focuses I have lost the moment which I wanted to capture.  It is slow to respond to a subject.  The pictures are very clear.  The videos can be spotty with the sound.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L810 16.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Tunno
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix L810 is a nice camera to start in photography, has a very good image quality and an excellent 26x optical zoom.This camera can not be used in manual mode, so it can not be controlled separately, aperture, shutter and other functions to get a better picture.I recommend if you're looking for a simple camera and very good image quality.Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed.
Reviews.Author: jmeluvzu
Reviews.Content: This camera is great if you're not trying to get action shots. It is sluggish and only does 1.2fps. That is my only complaint. Other than that it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent Camera
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Rico "Computer Programmer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, is a pretty decent camera, if you are a professional think in spend a lot more money, this camera is fine for domestic use in vacation, home party, etc. But don't get me wrong this is a good camera, is Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Dominique
Reviews.Content: It's a great camara and was at the perfect price, it works really well and it's easy to use. ..

Reviews.Title: Nikon comes through again
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This little point and shoot with 720p HD video works like a champ. Easy presets work well and are easy to get to. As with any point and shoot with a fixed lens, it can't earn 5 stars because the 26x zoom, well, just doesn't do that well. Overall a great little camera for family gatherings and vacations where lugging around a professional Nikon and lenses is not convenient.

Reviews.Title: Perfect value for mid grade camera
Reviews.Author: OMEB
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a present for my girlfriend. She loves taking pictures and is a complete amateur. For what she uses it for this camera is the best bang for your buck. The pictures she takes are fairly stunning and impressive for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great for everyday snapshots.
Reviews.Author: mstarrusa
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife to take photos mostly of the products she sells as well as for general family function photos. My wife is happy, so the world is a much better place. I would recommend this camera and seller.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: James R. Wildnauer
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but I will say from the different views I've read it is a difficult camera to use.Once I've read all the instructions for the camera and used it. I have no real complaints. I took the cameraOn a resent fishing trip in Montana,the pictures I took turned out great. It doesn't take a Rocket ScientistTo figure it out! Like any thing you buy today! Read the Manual, it helps

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera! Takes great looking pictures & the quality is great. Takes just as good of pictures as the more expensive cameras!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: hillari southworth
Reviews.Content: I've been looking into DSLR cameras for a while now and since they were out of my budget I decided to go with this camera. It does everything I would expect it to and actually fits my needs better than the DSLR would

Reviews.Title: Great Family Camera
Reviews.Author: Trever
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife this camera for her birthday. This is an easy to use camera. If you are looking for an easy to hassle free camera for family use this is the one. It has lots of features at a great price. It takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with Coolpix L810
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: I like it. Clear pictures in a laboratory setting with little natural light. I would recommend this camera for busness or personal use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: RK
Reviews.Content: I was totally impressed at the quality for the price.  I gave one to my parents for the 37 wedding anniversary.  Like what I saw so much I bought one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix L810 camera
Reviews.Author: CJRR
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic it takes really clear pictures, and I'm sure my husband and Daughter in Law will be happy to get these cameras For Christmas. They will be surprised at the quality and length this camera can go.Wonderful pictures taken by this camera and I was just testing them to be sure they worked. And they can do so much more.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Darnall "laughing lady"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 73rd birthday.  It is so easy to useand the pictures are such good quality.  The zoom bringsthe picture up so close.  I filmed some hummingbirds attheir feeders, and you could see their wings fluttering.Great little camera and good price too

Reviews.Title: Photophile
Reviews.Author: nozama
Reviews.Content: The 1- & 2-star reviewers must have freaked some sellers out into lowering their prices ever so briefly to land me a sweet deal - helped offset the new Calif. state tax for Amazon. This camera has no probs. whatsoever and my kids have been able to take pics without any blurring. Pics are top notch and camera is super easy to use. Maybe Nikon did put in a firmware fix - I don't know.

Reviews.Title: Great Performance at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Steve Red Dog
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a few weeks and I love it.  Takes great pictures near and far. Easy to use in auto or manual mode. Looking forward to taking it on vacation in a few weeks to Canada & New England.UPDATE:  Thoroughly enjoyed using this camera on our recent cruise. Versatile, easy to use, and great pix. Battery life was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: View Finder issue
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately when I purchased this camera I did not consider the consequences of not having a view finder... I tested the camera recently in a sunny location and found that it is very difficult to see the object being photographed by just using the LCD screen... I consider this to be a major drawback.

Reviews.Title: Good but not the best
Reviews.Author: Girl On Earth
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is pretty handy. Small enough to carry around and to take family pictures. There are many settings and it takes awhile to get used to them. Since I bought a memory chip with mine, I was able to take many pictures without memory problems. The batteries that come with the camera lasts pretty long.I love the camera and I can see myself carrying it to every event that I go to from now on.

Reviews.Title: I am not a professional photographer.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Oyler
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as an upgrade from a point and shoot camera that I was happy with but wanted more versatility.  It is an essentially point and shoot camera if you use the camera's auto mode.  you just have to pick from the apps what you are doing.  I can see that in a mixed setting such as a reunion, etc.  that you would be shooting scenery, food, portraits, and the like and having to stop and reset the auto mode would be time consuming.  but I am more of a quality rather than quantity person and this camera so far meets my expectations.  If I decide to get a little more creative then the ability is there.  This is a mid range camera for a subprofessional maybe on the way to professional.  I like it.

Reviews.Title: No Problem With the Nikon Coolpix L810!
Reviews.Author: Therapst's Lady
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon L810 about a month ago.  WHAT A GREAT CAMERA!!!  It's light, is easy to hold, and takes wonderful, clear photos.  Some people complained that the flash didn't always flash, even if they popped up the electronic flash.  Well, if you read the instruction book, there is a setting that will have the camera flash with every photo (as fill-in, or for dark locations).  Additionally, some comments were made that the camera doesn't focus well and they get fuzzy photos.  This is not the case if you wait-perhaps a second or two-until the green box appears.  Now I will admit that I do not take sports photos, so waiting a second or two for me is not a problem.  I agree with those reviewers who reiterate that you MUST read the instruction book.  This is not a point and shoot camera.  This camera is more for someone who likes to use different settings for different effects.  Once you practice with it--go around your house and take lots of photos, both inside and out--you will become familiar with the camera and be able to take gorgeous photos with it.  This camera is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: It's a nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ie shah
Reviews.Content: Bought few months ago....it's a nice camera however, I expected too much of perfect quality. But with this price is great, really love the zoom in the camera and love the fact it do not drain batteries quick...

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob Trewyn
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with my decision to purchase the Nikon Coolpix 810. I does everything I expected and more, besides taking excellent pictures. over 300 pics before having to change batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: evan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the quality and clarity of this camera! Especially for the price. I would easily pay $300 USD for a camera with such great zoom and quality. I have impressed many professional photographers with pictures from this camera! If you haven't bought this camera, do it! And if you have, great choice! :DP.S. If you look in the customer photos, I posted a few under the name of "evan."

Reviews.Title: I would never buy another Nikon.
Reviews.Author: gatsby
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 cool pix. Both lasted about a year. Bought them from Best Buy. Impossible to return them after a year. Crappy camera. You lost me as a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Experience!
Reviews.Author: Jack D. Salzman
Reviews.Content: When the camera arrived we noticed that the photos had random blurry areas, almost in a halo around the point of focus. We shipped the camera to Nikon and they had it for over a month. When we finally got it back, the blurriness was gone but all of our photos had a pink tint. We tried adjusting every setting on the camera to no avail. So, we shipped the camera back to Nikon yet again. This time they had it for over two months. When I contacted them to see what the status was, about 30 days into the repair, they told me it was on a "parts hold". Finally got the camera back with a laundry list of what had been done to "fix" the problem. However, all the pictures still looked pink. We sent it back to them three separate times for the pink issue. FINALLY, 6 months after buying the camera, the pink issue was resolved. In its place... a fuzzy black line straight down the center of every picture. Sent it back to Nikon AGAIN and now they have lost our camera and are putting the responsibility on us to prove it, even though it was their UPS ship label I used to send it back. Each time, to get the camera "repaired", and I use that term loosely, I had to first submit a support request on their website, after which I would receive a response within a few days. I couldn't respond back to the email but instead had to log back in to their website to "add to my question". They would provide a link to download a UPS label to ship the camera back. It took 2-4 days each time for them to acknowledge that they received the camera. There were never any updates regarding the status of the repair, when we could expect to get the camera back, or any other communication on their part. I tried contacting them by phone and requesting to speak to someone higher up the food chain and never really got anywhere. Singularly the worst customer service experience I have EVER had. I will NEVER buy another Nikon product. A shame, since the Nikon I purchased this to replace was a pretty decent camera until it wore out.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a piece of (expletive deleted)! DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Vickie Cyr
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nikon Coolpix L810 in June of 2012.  It worked fantastic - pictures were great!  I don't take a lot of photographs, and I let it sit for a couple of months. Then at Christmas I took it to my daughter's house for family celebration.  Took two pix and the camera stopped working, said batteries were dead.  Lens was out 1/2 way and lights went out.  I didn't have batteries with, as the ones in the camera weren't that old.  Fortunately I had my iPhone so I was able to get a few family pix.When I returned home I replaced the batteries with new ones but it wouldn't work.Took the camera back to where I bought it.  Service guy looked it over, said there obviously was no damage to the camera and sent it in to be fixed on Jan 20, 2013.  I got it back a week later. I opened it, put everything back on and tried it.  Worked great!  Put it back in the camera bag.Today, one week later, I took the camera out of the bag to take a pic of the dog covered in snow.  I was in the house so the camera was not cold.  Batteries were dead again.  I put brand new ones in and it wouldn't work - same as before, lens 1/2 out and lights go out.  I took the batteries out and checked them and they are fine.  Batteries are in correctly, because it did the same thing it did before - the lens came out 1/2 way and the light died.Based on other negative reviews I would say DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!  If I could give it zero stars or NEGATIVE stars, I would do so!I had a first generation digital Olympus that I replaced only because I couldn't buy the cards for it anymore. Got the Nikon based on reviews, and the 26X Zoom. So disappointed!! I will NEVER buy a Nikon product again, not even if Paul Simon himself sold it to me for $1 along with Kodachrome film!

Reviews.Title: I HATE IT
Reviews.Author: J.R. Koch
Reviews.Content: Camera was a big disappointment.. in almost every way..unacceptable ...will certainly return. Reasons: very slow focus, veryslow shutter speed, blurry pictures, (even though it says that it is focused) Primary use is to use when photographingchildren. For this purpose it is especialy unacceptable..very little about camera can be said to live up to advertising andpromo given for camera.

Reviews.Title: High end of the low end cameras/one setback
Reviews.Author: WINuser1
Reviews.Content: This camera can take a great picture.  I've taken some for calendars, etc. at the highest quality settings and was very pleased with the results.  This camera can also be painfully slow to focus for close-up work and sometimes it simply can't auto focus on an object.  I read some reviews about the slow focus and figured it was user related and bet on Nikon quality.  I wouldn't buy this camera again or recommend it because of the slow focus however.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera for the price
Reviews.Author: mamahobbit
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my obsolete 2.1mp 7.5x zoom Canon PowerShot-  I wanted to have zoom that would allow close-ups, but was unable to afford it... until I found this camera.  The zoom is a little hard to fine-tune- seems to zoom way in or way out too fast, but I'm adjusting to it.  I LOVE the camera performance in low-light conditions.  I have not needed to use flash indoors at all, and it has captured nice nuances of light & dark without manual adjustments- something this camera idiot appreciates.  I was able to take indoor pics of my art students' self-portraits for our on-line art gallery within minutes of taking it out of the box.  Haven't had time to learn how to use the other features yet, but it is loaded!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jolyn Axelgard
Reviews.Content: I have been really enjoying my new camera!!  I love the zoom!  It is great for taking pictures of the kids!  It takes a little getting used to.  My first pictures were blurry, but I got the hang of it!

Reviews.Title: a gem
Reviews.Author: Reuel "drj"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a little gem.  I was expecting something more like an old F2 I used to carry but instead this is about half the size and weight.  On a recent trip, I envied other travelers with big SLRs only slightly.  This camera does >90% of what I want and is very convenient to carry all day touring.Pros:+ high pixel count (lots of detail)+ high zoom (the limit of hand-held)+ normal batteries that last very long+ good feel in the hand+ most conditions give excellent picturesCons:- sometimes lagging shutter- only indirect control of exposure or shutter speed- no eyepiece (which would be especially valuable in full sun)- some conditions cannot be compensated, producing poor picturesThe camera can produce outstanding pictures. The limitations and trade-offs compared to a SLR are acceptable.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great camera!  It's well designed and fairly easy to operate, especially for a digital camera.  It takes a fantastic photo if you have it on the right setting.  Take the time to learn how to use it, famialiarize yourself with the instructions and you'll be fine.  The only thing I would change about it is the flash should pop up automaticly, not need to be manually lifted. Otherwise i'm very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Virologygeek
Reviews.Content: Like most people, I was really skeptical making an online purchase of a camera! But, this camera is awesome. If you cannot afford a DSL, this is the closest you can get. I work in a biology lab and use it even to take scientific pictures (e.g. animal models etc.) and this is great!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Joanne Smith
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the product. The picture quality was low grade and the shuttle button would stick. I like the size and the way it fit my hand. My brother has one and I was impressed with the camera, however this item's performance was bad. I believe it was a defective item.  I also missed the added view finder that is found in other models.

Reviews.Title: Love my Nikon
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S. Tate
Reviews.Content: I love my new Nikon COOLPIX L810 camera in candy apple red. This camera is not complicated to use, but not as simple as a point and shoot.  It has many options with easy to see and use icons. I priced this camera in several camera shops in my area and saved $70.00 purchasing through Amazon.  The service was great receiving my camera in 3 days as promised.  Thanks AMAZONI have purchased many items from AMAZON new and used books as well as hard to find items.  I can always count on AMAZON for items from A to Z

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Marie Daniels
Reviews.Content: This is my first bridge camera. Always had the cheap point and clicks and my last one was the nikon L20. Man this camera is amazing I just love it. For the price you can't go wrong. Comes with 2 cd's, 1 is a manual and the other is ViewNX2 software which is for editing your photos and videos, 1 usb cable for your pc, 1 RCA cable for the t.v. and a strap. Just played with it for about 20 minutes and while I'm no professional (but want to be) this is a great beginner to work your way up to the SLR's. This was 1 of 4 gifts for my birthday. Thanks Dom. Would recommend.Update: Just an awesome camera! Check out the 2 pitures I took after 20 minutes of playing with it.1. The Bumble Bee on my railing.2. My beloved chihuahua in black & white.

Reviews.Title: Great value camera
Reviews.Author: J. Noell
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome for the money.  I bought this camera to take pictures at my wedding and on a family vacation and it was awesome.  Like others have said, it takes a little practice to get used to but once you read the directions and figure out how to use it, the camera will take quality pictures that rival many high dollar DSLR's.

Reviews.Title: coolpix L180
Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera for the money.It is easy to use just review the booklet that comes with it first.You can set it in auto and the camera will make the adjustments for light and clairty.Or you can put it in to manual .It also has a video camera within this camera.I would reccomend this camera  to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever had!
Reviews.Author: Shay
Reviews.Content: I just got my camera yesterday, i was a little concerned about how well it would work from some of the comments people have made about it, but after one hour working with it I now know how it likes to work and Love it! Best thing I ever did. At first it was just to replace my old cam that had a black smudge under the lense ruining my shots, and wanted a cam to take some shots for my book's cover, but after using it for the past day I think I'll try doing some pro stuff here and there with it! I'm very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: coolpix l810
Reviews.Author: Paul Barginear
Reviews.Content: I got for my wife to take pictures of her flowers. She was surprised that the camera was small and light weight. She took pictures with it and was amazed at the quality and sharpness. Very pleased with the camera

Reviews.Title: Very good Price/Quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this Nikon. I saw negative as well as positive reviews and when I finally bought it I thought I hope I'll like it or I'll just return it if it has a problem.I ordered it on Monday at noon and it was delivered Tuesday at 10 thanks to Amazon and the prime shipping. When I got it I immediately started testing it.I'm a beginner but I like pretty pictures with a good quality and easy to use cameras. This camera is very easy when you put it on auto mode.The macro is unbelievable. The quality is awesome I love it.I also went out at night and my pictures are really good.I tried the zoom at night and the quality isn't there, most of my photos where blurry. But the zoom is nice during the day with very clear photos even from far away.I still have a lot to explore in this camera but I am already very happy by the quality it procures for the price I paid.I recommend it for people like me : Beginners who like an easy camera taking very clear photos but definitely not for someone who's really into photography and who wants an almost professional camera because this is not it!

Reviews.Title: Great features on the paper, but not very usable in reality
Reviews.Author: Nar Gar "NG"
Reviews.Content: First off let me shed some light on the 29 minute video recording...The SD cards used in the camera have FAT32 file system formatting which allows for 4GB file size maximum, i.e. each single file cannot be bigger than 4GB.Depending on how fine is the video quality, one can record as long of a video as a single 4GB file can hold.So this is not a camera fault but a memory card limitation - NOT just for this camera, but for EVERYTHING that uses SD cards.Now the major design flaw of many NIKON cameras is the placement of the mics inside the camera body instead of the flash popup - the same body that also contains all the motor parts, which vibrate and make noise - regardless of the noise level. Need I say that when recording video the zoom and focus motor noises are loudly audible in the video? This means that zooming / focusing and video recording don't go together in this camera.What a shame, really, for an otherwise good quality product.Since I purchased this camera from a store that's 10K miles away from me now, I simply cannot return it. So thinking of selling it for a half price.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: TRENCH
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA, EASY TO USE. LOVE THE COLOR OF THIS CAMERA (BLUE). WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE. I REALLY LIKE THE ZOOM.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: It takes excellent pictures and is easy to use. There are some features i would like to see like in other models, for example pause video recording.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Brodowski
Reviews.Content: I wanted a good camera with high resolution at a decent price - I found it with the COOLPIX. I am very pleased thus far.

Reviews.Title: DSLR
Reviews.Author: Pattycruiser
Reviews.Content: This camera gives you the feel of a DSLR without having to take along any extra equipment. The pictures are crystal clear and it is easy to use. The 26x gives more than adequate zoom range. I got the blue color as a tribute to my now deceased mother as blue was her favorite color.

Reviews.Title: nice camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Trujillo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago and so far I am pretty satisfied. The only thing is that I would have preferred to have rechargeable batteries instead of the regularones. Pictures nice and clear but sometimes when a picture is done is out of focus...I am not sure if it's me or the camera.In conclusion, it was a nice buy!

Reviews.Title: Its good!!
Reviews.Author: jt30
Reviews.Content: I do like this camera, I just recieved it today!! Only and ONLY thing I would change is that the camera does NOT come with a lens cover?!?!?!?! I guess I thoguht this was standard on all cameras, guess I should've read more in depth...Just have to be super careful with it!!

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY - DONT BUY - DONT BUY
Reviews.Author: Marty5220
Reviews.Content: This camera is a complete P.O.S. Purchased it in July and went dead in August. Got 5 weeks of use out of it. I turn the power light on, it comes on for 3 seconds and powers down. Batteries are brand new. Won't even work when plugged into my laptop. I have heard good things about Nikon, but clearly this particular product is defective. Judging by the reviews here and messages on other sites, this is a common problem. I recommend you not buy this camera. There are so many good cameras out there. Sucks to flush $300 down the toilet. Do yourself a favor and do not make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: A bad decision.
Reviews.Author: Al F
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas present for my wife based on the manufacturer's reputation.  Bad move.  My wife was getting very turned on to photography and I thought this would help.  Wrong!  The camera is a pain in the lower posterior.  I will be lucky if she ever picks up a camera again.  We are both into our second half century.  Perhaps it would be better for a child.  The program logic is totally un-logic.  Why, for instance, would you want to take off a lens cap to view the pictures that have already been taken?  With this camera you must.  There are no, I repeat zero, manual control overrides.  You cannot chose anything except preprogrammed settings with names that often do not help us find the right choice.  Even if there is an appropriate setting it takes forever to find and select it.  We will seek a different camera from another source when we can afford to try again.  I have never been so disappointed with a product.

Reviews.Title: It does not work (I bought it july 2012)
Reviews.Author: Iryna Martinez
Reviews.Content: I have a problem now with my camera too.Did not use it too often. Lenses don't work and screen doesn't turn on (((( I bought it in July 2012. I regret of this purchase If someone wants a camera just for 6 month they can buy it.Not recommend it!!!! Just money waste.Even don't know now if I want them to repair it or replace, or just forget about itI wish if I had known about these cameras what i know now.My husband wants to sent it to manufacture to repair.I will update my review about results

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kari L Baker
Reviews.Content: All pictures were blurry and it took 3 times of pressing the on/off button for the camera to finally turn on. The zoom was also not functional and the camera frooze, forcing me to turn off the camera and struggle to turn it back on again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon WARRANTY SUCKS
Reviews.Author: DD56
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY A NIKON CAMERA~!!!!!!!!!!!Got Nikon camera for Christmas. DH even bought extended warranty so I'd have a total of 3 yrs warranty.2nd time I tried to charge the camera the CHARGER BLEW UP.I do not know if it damaged the camera or not.I called Nikon and they said it sounded like a short in the USB cable/charger, so go buy another one and see if the camera works.They would NOT send me a replacement cable to check it out, even though they sold me a faulty one with the camera.Nikon will also NOT exchange the camera.I called the extended warranty and they would do nothing because it was still under manufacturer warranty.So here I am with a BRAND NEW NIKON camera and NO ONE WILL DO A BLASTED THING ABOUT IT~! But what I can do is to warn good people out there about the Nikon scam.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera! Great quality for price!
Reviews.Author: Susan 1220
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I took some time to read the manual and play with the different functions. The various photo settings are great! I took some test shots that proved that the specific photo settings work. I took a picture with light in the background at a normal setting and then a "background lit" specified setting. The pictures are vastly different with the clarity & color of the one taken at the specified setting being much better. I also played with the "sports" and "snow" photo settings. They also proved to be stellar. I got some amazing pictures of my son playing football that are very clear even though he never stops moving. The other reviews were accurate about having to hold the button down halfway to allow it to focus, then pressing all the way to take the picture. This instruction is also in the manual. When opperated correctly, this camera is great! I would definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: like it a lot...not so much a lot anymore
Reviews.Author: keepingitreal
Reviews.Content: **updating a year later and changing from 4 stars to 3 stars.  This camera is extremely slow when taking pictures.  You also have to hold down the button in a particular way or it will not take the photo at all.  The lens cap is still an issue for me.  There is an error message and delay in turning on if you forget to remove the lens before turning camera on.  This I do often, and I knew it was going to my downfall for shooting with this camera.  *I have one of the first Coolpix cameras made, but it does not work anymore because of an internal flutter problem (I haven't tried to send it in for repair).  It turns on, but I only get a screen that looks like lines jumping vertically.  With that being said, it took the most amazing pictures in all types of lighting: concerts, fireworks, Christmas lights, laser lighting, etc. I really used and abused that camera.  I am disappointed in Nikon because it appears that the cameras are being made cheaper and of lesser quality than in the past.love this camera.  i am giving it 4 stars though because the time it takes to take a photo is annoying.  It is especially frustrating if you are taking pictures of babies or nature.  the blue color is beautiful.  the zoom feature is great.  make sure you take the lens cap off before turning on the camera.  I definitely see this as the future downfall of this camera for myself.  i have always turned on my cameras before removing the lens to get ready.  You will get an error message and instruction to turn off your camera and then remove lens cap if you accidentally do this.  the black and white scene setting takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix Camera
Reviews.Author: eslanni
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I bought this for my son as a graduating present in the Air Force because I figured it was light and easy to use and good quality and it is all three.  He loves the camera and it is a great beginner camera for someone who loves photography but is on a bit of a budget.  I have a really nice Pentax camera and take a lot of pictures with it and I wasnt sure how this camera would compare to mine, but it is acutally an excellant camera, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Cam!!
Reviews.Author: Josy
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is great for amateurs like my husband and myself. It has great zoom, you just have to focus the camera...its not blurry...pictures come out clean and , the cam is fast ...it does its job well. I think it was great for the price and shipping was fast. My advice is to skim through the CD for easy how to's with the camera.

Reviews.Title: High quality camera for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Olpdog
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to Las Vegas and attempted to take a picture with my old digital zoom camera and received a notification that the rechargeable battery was dead. I could have purchased a cheap replacement battery on Amazon, but I couldn't find a replacement battery in the Vegas area, so I decided to purchase a new camera. The old camera I had was very simple and only had a digital zoom, which doesn't compare with the optical zoom of this camera. I looked around and found this Nikon on sale at the Best Buy in Las Vegas and purchased it immediately. I was taking a day trip to Lake Mead and picked up the Nikon on the way there. I took a lot of pictures and a few videos and, for the most part, they look great! I only read the very basics of use, ie; battery install, zoom and how to take a video/picture, so I didn't get all the pictures properly focused, but the vast majority look great. Part of me wishes they included an internal rechargeable battery with this camera, but after facing the sudden death of a camera that relied on those internal batteries, I think I prefer having a camera with batteries that can be purchased most anywhere I go. Those internal rechargeable batteries seem to be made specifically for each camera you purchase so finding a replacement immediately available is fairly unlikely. For the price, I don't think you're going to find a better camera. I did purchase a 16GB memory card to use with the Nikon and the 200 pictures and 15 minutes of HD recording I made still leave me with 12GB of open space on the card.

Reviews.Title: Back to Basics (and more)
Reviews.Author: Ms Debe
Reviews.Content: I've had Nikon Camera's for years until my last one somehow disappeared.  Was able to receive a new Nikon CoolPix L810 from a friend of mine (Thank You Mr Angel), I truly have to say that this Nikon CoolPix is Fabulous!! It has many options i.e., Smart Portrait is great does the thinking for You, also easy to save/transfer Pics to PC.  In the past was required to download Manufacturers Program to remove Pics store Pics to computer.Thanks Nikon COOLPIX L810

Reviews.Title: Cool Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me the Nikon Cool Pix for my birthday. I am still discovering all the functions. I love it! The only negative is that there is no view finder. If it's too sunny or bright out it is a little difficult to see what you are doing. All in all it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: TomasLomas
Reviews.Content: I have taken a variety of pictures with my Nikon Cool Pix L810 and am pleased with the results.  It takes some practice as well as reading and studying the manual but the results are worth it. Blurred images can be a problem but experimenting with various modes cures the problems.  I had one hiccup with the Smart Portrait mode where the picture would not save to the memory card that was recommended by Amazon--Transcend 16 GB.  When I got a San Disk 16GB card recommended by Nikon the problem was solved.  I wish that Amazon would recommend memory cards that have been tested by Nikon for the camera.  I had to find out the hard way later although the Transcend card works fine for most of the camera functions.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: sassylass
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use camera with fairly good visibility during high light. I can actually see the lcd in the sun.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Tutu
Reviews.Content: Ordered this through Adorama cameras here on amazon, wasn't expecting much since I read almost all the reviews before getting this.First of all, I got this one day before a sea trip that I took. I didn't expect it to take good pictures of moving objects, but was surprised when I took several photos of people jumping off the boat in mid-air. They weren't 100% accurate, but for a digital camera in the price range it was great.The flash isn't bad either, took a few night photos of people and it was pretty handy.One thing I noticed was it was horrible for night shots, but that wasn't an issue since most cameras are. The size of the L810 was perfect for me as I have small hands, also that the size was handy and easier to carry than a DSLR.Overall this camera is great. It was more than I expected and the shape was also very appealing. Much better than a normal digital camera and the zoom isn't that bad either.If you want a camera that can be handy, yet of quality, then this is the right choice :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: So, where do I start? My girlfriend has her own business as a professional photographer, and I like taking photos too. (Just not extremely fancy like she does.) I bought a cheap $100 camera a few years ago, and that's what it was, cheap. It took a few really good photos, but that's if the camera focused "just right". Well, I wanted to take better pictures, so I bought this. Let's put it this way, my road is about 1/2 mile long, and there are bridges on both sides. I can walk to one end, zoom in the camera all the way, and the other bridge will take up the screen on the camera, so it's got super zoom! The camera itself cannot make panoramic images (if you're into that thing) but it does include software for your computer that can "stitch" images into a panoramic scene. Also, it has the capability of 720p video with one button. I could go on and on, but in short, this is a really good camera for a very good price. If you need an upgrade, you should probably look into this one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L810 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill B. Williams
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is light, compact, takes beautiful pictures, and is easy to use. It turns on quickly and is ready to go. But I do have a couple of complaints:1) The zoom is too fast! When trying to frame a shot by zooming in just a little, it will always over-shoot my desired zoom, requiring me to zoom in and out to get what I want.2) The camera is not designed to accept lens filters, and that surprised me. Over the past 45 years I have owned many SLRs and have ALWAYS installed a neutral density filter to protect the lens from dust and finger prints. I can't do that with this camera. Nikon could have easily made this camera to accept lens filters. Nikon should have known better.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: I don't believe this camera can be beat for the money.  Excellent features, easy to use, and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: WAITING FOR IT TO BE SHIPPED
Reviews.Author: Forrest W. Smith "moviemadnessman"
Reviews.Content: I just played with this camera at target and in just 10 minutes I figured a lot out! and the camera is very friendly to use with people who love figuring new things out as well (others who are a little technology illiterate may take longer to figure out)!!From what I played with at Target zoomed all the way in it takes beautiful depth of field sharp shots! I just bought this item off Amazon because it was 299 at target (249 at wall-mart) so I am saving a lot! The camera is a lot smaller than it seems on pictures!! I am so psyched it is coming by Thursday (today's Tuesday)!! I wanted the blue :( but it wouldn't ship for 4-7 weeks so I got the black to have it in 2 days before my trip to Jersey for the weekend!! Next week or so I will update you guys about it! So excited!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Audrey Frizzell
Reviews.Content: Got everything packaged well and on time! i haven't used it too much. but so far so good! looking forward to using it on my trip.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: C Woods
Reviews.Content: excellent camera! great zoom and easy to use. took this camera on many trips, no problems. would buy this again. Easy to use,

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Steele
Reviews.Content: A great little camera for the money.  I'm taking it to Europe in a few weeks.  It's much easier to handle than a full size Nikon and a heck of a lot better price.  I won't completely lose my mind if it gets lost.  I was way too nervous on my previous trip with my niece's D3100.  Highly recommended.  It responds quickly and it's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I am a Nikon convert!
Reviews.Author: Jean Phoenix
Reviews.Content: My first Nikon camera and I am definitely a convert. I love taking movies and completed an hour-long video for a class assignment and made an A in it! Hooray! Also digital photos are great.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Nancy Jo Kacmar
Reviews.Content: VERY VERY VERY CONFUSING TO USE. HAD TO HAVE MY NEPHEW..(COLLEGE GRADUATE) JUST TO FIGURE IT OUT. GREAT GADGET BUT NEWS BETTER INSTRUCTION OR U TUBE SHOWING HOW TO USE IT!! STILL WOULD BUY AGAIN!!@

Reviews.Title: Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Works great but didn't come with lens cap or charger. Great zoom and other functions, especially for an armature  in takin pictures

Reviews.Title: Used Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Rusty Manning
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this used camera.  I put my batteries in it.  (None supplied)  I powered it up.  It let me set the time zone and time and date.  I went to the photo mode.  I got an error message telling me to turn off the camera and remove the lens cap.  That's funny.  There was no lens cap either.  You couldn't get past this error message so the camera couldn't take pictures.  Which made it worthless.

Reviews.Title: It broke!
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago, and had used it on maybe 5 occasions and during a weeklong trip. I expected it to last much longer than the few uses I got out of it since I kept it in great condition and stored it in the box it came in.Overall, it was a pretty good camera when it worked. If your looking for a good camera that can last more than the 300 or so pictures I got out of the crappy purchase, I'd go with another camera. As far as the warranty goes, lets just say I'm pretty sure I just wasted $200 dollars.

Reviews.Title: L810
Reviews.Author: G. Hippeli
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Nikon quality. Good quality works well. My two negatives are. This camera does not have a viewfinder. Thought I could do without it. I was wrong. Can't see the screen in bright light. Number two the extreme zoom forces me back to using a tripod. The image stabilization won't help here.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Gloria1954
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my granddaughter who is very interested in photography, for a first camera this worked fine. I wish it would have come with the cables, but all in all it was a perfect gift.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: lovin&livin
Reviews.Content: My daughter bought this camera and really loves it.  She is enjoying it very much.  It's a very good first dslr for her.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix l810
Reviews.Author: nika
Reviews.Content: hello I do not recommend buying this camera because I bought and after a few months very bad work became.

Reviews.Title: My favorite color
Reviews.Author: D. R. Smith
Reviews.Content: Ok, being red had a lot to do with my selection, but it is a really good camera.  I take some amazing shots.  It turns itself off after a minute or so of inactivity.  I've had to send it back to the shop to be repaired 3 times because you can't just take this to a local shop.  There aren't any exterior parts.  Customer service is good and I only had to pay the first time.  What happens is I get some shots that look like a film camera has the film off-center, some of the picture comes through at the edges, and the rest is black.  I hope this is the last time because it's about a 2 week turn-around time from the time I send it to when I get it back, and I go through camera withdrawal.  I use this nearly every week and have great shots of the birds on the lake and in my back yard, plus family events.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work well. It would power off without any reason we could see. We thought it was the batteries but after switching them out for new ones we realized it is a problem with the camera. Reviewers on other sites had the same issue. The camera stopped working completely a year and a half after we purchased it but since we were past warranty period Nikon said they could prepare a cost quote for them to repair it. We don't want to spend any more on this camera so we will purchase a new one that is not a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nice Model
Reviews.Author: gabi.
Reviews.Content: meet my expectations.This camera was something that I was dying to get.Definatly worth the purchase.i love this cameraThis is a fantastic

Reviews.Title: Great but there are better ones
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: Great product but spend the extra money to get a camera with an interchangeable lens but the smaller better cameras out there

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jesse T. Hall "JT Hall"
Reviews.Content: has all the features I need....16.1mp. 26x zoom and it WORKS great! Simple to use, all the shooting modes are clearly outlined in the internal programs. Nice look too!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L810 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley Thrower
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It takes great pictures and videos.  The resolution is perfect.  I advertise this product every where I use it.  Every one is inspired by the great pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - slow in shooting.
Reviews.Author: Henry Obando
Reviews.Content: Hi! I rated this camera with four starts and not five just because I found one issue that didn't like.  It is that the camera is not very fast processing shooting pictures.  What I want to say is that the camera takes around two or three seconds to get ready to take a second shot.  This is not really nice when you are trying to take pictures of an event that is happening very fast (or faster than regular events).  I even set the camera for the sport events, and noticed that the camera is slow getting ready from one shot to another.Besides that little detail, the camera is very compact, light, has good resolution, and contains many features that are still great to take great pictures.  I like the zoom, and it is of great quality.  I would recommend buying this camera if you are interested in getting pictures of great quality, indoor or outdoor.  Just keep in mind that it is not good for taking multiple pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Aminata "Adventure lover"
Reviews.Content: Great camera and easy to use.  Still learning some of the features but have captured some very good shots.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very disapointed
Reviews.Author: Heriberto Guevara Rivero "Heriberto"
Reviews.Content: I was xpecting bigger camera with better quality at least, but this one came with AA Battery so bad I wanted something better then that.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Victor Attipoe
Reviews.Content: I bought this ring for my girlfriend. Its so cool that I wanted to get one for myself! It has everything on it as described and the color and picture is excellent

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Wagner "i am sandman7"
Reviews.Content: Mine didn't come with a manual, so I'm still trying to figure out how to get the setting just right.  The flash can be a bit overpowering, so learning around that.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for son.
Reviews.Author: J. Mellon "mopman"
Reviews.Content: My son likes taking pictures.  He shows a talent in photography.  So I gave him this camera for Christmas last year (I am late on the review).  He loves it.  It is so easy to use and with it he takes great pictures.  In fact this year on 11/13 I asked him if he wanted me to get him a new camera and he said "no, I want to get more use out of this one".  I was shocked.  Good job Nikon.

Reviews.Title: You can do better
Reviews.Author: J. Capobianco
Reviews.Content: I have collected ( and used ) cameras for over 30 years. I picked up a Display Model of this camera last week for $89.99 so I couldn't resist. The idea of having a 22.5mm to 585mm with the Nikon name for that price was a no- brainier. The images looked pretty good on the screen when I shot in the store, I drove by the coast before heading home and shot about 60 different images as well as video. The camera was a Huge disappointment.. The images on the computer screen looked like they were make out of sand the grittiness was so bad under enlargement, I have old 4mp cameras that perform better. The edges are a bit soft on the lens, backlit subject create it to mis-focus and video zoom freezes randomly. On top of that it can take forever to find focus when shooting video. Avoid the headache, the Fuji fine pix s4200 is Much better. 16 mp is a big mistake for a small sensor, Nikon is not what Nikon used to be..I returned it.Update 3/7/14- picked up the Panasonic Dmc-FZ35 yesterday, far superior! check out that review and buy that instead.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: M. Urso
Reviews.Content: This is last years model, the 820 replaced it.  This 810 is still high quality for a really nice zoom point and shoot.  Takes AA batteries so you can always get them.  Never run out of charge and can't find a charger time.  Replaces a much simpler camera.  Great glass in the lense and take decent 720p video.

Reviews.Title: PESIMO PRODUCTO
Reviews.Author: Jesus D.
Reviews.Content: This profucto NOT FULFILLED WITH EXPECTATIONS WAS ALL A SCAM, opening the package, the first thing you notice is that the box was not new, has aboyadura, frdgadtr, to get the camera observe the display NO had the protective plastic, noise that made me, then install the batteries and the camera what lit ...the camera was ordered from Venezuela ... what kind of insults, you like to read?How do I get all the readers I know what that one is disillusioned by this kind of dishonesty and the risk that the user in another country has to make these purchases?Sr. Jesus Suarez jdanielsg@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Heath B.
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for Christmas a few days before we got married. She takes it with her everywhere. Shes never really had a great camera to play with until this one. Since she has had it she has bought extra lenses and has really taken this on as a hobby.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L810 16.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Habs fan
